text: Chipotle is my "fast food". I eat here at least twice a week. The night crew and day crew are like night and day! No pun intended. I avoid this location during the day because the staff is immature and the management is TERRIBLE. It's like eating at two different restaurants. I stood in line along with two other customers as employees chatted behind the counter and ate hot cheetos.

I wanted to share how extremely dissatisfied I was with their service tonight. I have a large family and my husband usually goes in and orders for us. The girls gave him attitude the last two times and said "why dont you order online for large orders?". Well, tonight we decided to order online. I was a little frustrated as you cannot order quesadillas online. I scheduled my pick up to be 6pm. I got to the store about 5 minutes early. I saw the staff working on the order. I went to the cashier and asked, is this the order for **** - she said yes. I said ok, I wanted to order 4 cheese quesadillas but there was no where to order online. She looked at the gentleman standing next to her and he said oh we are super busy - you need to go to the line.. Mind you the line was long and going very slow. Also, the thing they used to make the quesadillas was sitting behind the gentleman. Well - 20 minutes in line and i was finally able to order the quesadillas. I got back up to the cashier and the gentleman put my bags from the online order on the counter. I reached in the bags and all the items were COLD. I said to him, all this food is cold! He said well we made it to be ready for you on time. I said I understand that but you said I had to go in line. He could care less that the food was cold and brushed me off. No discount or nothing was offered. At this point I was furious as I just spent over $80 on cold food. When I got the food home and my family unwrapped their food, the tacos were soggy and fell apart, the burritos were soggy and fell apart.. it was a mess and I only live across the street.. I will never go to this Chipotle again as the staff is extremely rude. Like I said, this was not the 1st encounter my family has had with the rude staff there. We did not eat the food and ended up having to go pick up $5 pizzas from little cesars. Well worth it to drive a little further to the Chipotle on Sahara or at Arroyo Crossing.

I will never eat here again. Honestly, every single thing, even the rice, tasted like they poured a gallon of salt into it. I wasted pretty much my whole meal because I couldn't handle how salty it was. The highlight was my iced tea that I had to chug to get the salt taste out of my mouth. Just gross.

I came into this establishment with my service dog. I simply wanted a meal so I could sit outside and enjoy myself. Instead I was very rudely asked for all of my service dogs credentials and I was denied service when I told them they had no right to ask me for her ID's.  I will never come back to any of these establishments again. I've never been treated so poorly. The staff of  this chipotle needs to be retrained on costumer service. I feel extremely disrespected, I shouldn't have to answer to anyone as to why I need my service dog.

Food was great like always but the the people who work they're don't seem to care about the customers they help at all.  The looked clueless and completely un-energetic. Maybe they just don't want to be at work but it translates to poor customer service.  The location is nice and the inside was done well like most Chipotles but the lack of interest by the workers just made the whole experience forgetful.  I think the next time I'm hungry I'll pass on this place.
She didn't have pink eye. She just had eye surgery. She slept on her contact lence and it tore a layer from her eye. It doesn't hurt to ask before we judge.

Best Chipotle in the Las Vegas Valley. I have been a regular customer for over two years at this location and each and every service has been consistent. Friendly, great service, quick lines, and quality food. The seating areas are constantly cleaned and attended to. Overall, a great place to eat and hangout.
Chipotle never fails.  This new location is outstanding and tasy.  I'm certainly going back.  It's one of my favorite places to eat.  Chipotle is definitely worth trying.

They only get stars for food quality. The service and the preparation has gone to crap at most chipotles. The kids they put in charge are clueless and the skimping on portions is insulting for the money you pay. $15 fast food meals should not be just for salsa and lettuce toppings. Management at this location is mediocre at best. They once forgot to pack my quesadilla in the order and I called when I got home they said oh just let us know next time you come in and we will add one. But when I did a week later they had "no record" of it. LOL, we are talking about a plain cheese quesa... The same ppl who were giving away food to get its customers back not to long ago, could not part with some cheese and a tortilla to keep a customer. FAIL.

THIS CHIPOTLE SUCKS. they have 4 to 5 idiots in the back screwing around when there is literally 15 people waiting in line. Yes I counted. 1 idiot on register and 1 idiot making all the food. 1! And if it's not 1 it's 2. Step your employee game up and learn how to handle rush hour I go to plenty of other locations on Vegas and they fly compared to these idiots. Learn to hurry the fuck up its not that hard your menu has less than 10 things to make. Unbelievable

This location of Chipotle is expedient, clean, and definitely service oriented the times I have visited. I work just down the street and come here at least 2-3x a month when I want a quick and easy lunch. Right next to Starbucks and BofA so very convienient!!

I wish I could give negative stars! Horrible service. September has a special that kids eat free on Sundays. We were there because my nephew wanted to eat chipotle for his birthday today. We ordered one for our child that was in her stroller and was being watched by my mother-in-law.  The lady said we needed to be charged for the kids meal because we didn't have the child with us. Then they had the nerve to speak to each other in Spanish about the kids meal ordeal. Just because I'm of different ethnicity, don't assume we can't speak Spanish and don't talk s*** in front of customers in a different language. As we were at the register they informed us that we had to pay for the kids meal. We showed the child and asked if there was a issue, they told us no and said that the kids meal is normally for older children, granted the child was a little over 1. I don't see anything wrong with feeding mashed beans to a 1 year old. Also I didn't see that there was a stipulation to the age of a child to qualify for a kids meal. After we settled that issue, the guy at the register came up to us and stated our card was declined so we showed our receipt and cleared up that issue. I observed if he was going to ask the customers before and after us but he didn't. Very rude and very unprofessional. I don't know how this restaurant is ran but it clearly needs its staff to be retrained or let go. This our first and last time coming to this location. Very disappointing.
This place has been on point every time. I did have a problem one time but they helped me and took care of me to the max! Amazing crew and management is awesome!

Everyone loves Chipotle but not me. I've been to two different locations. Both times the steak was so fatty that I couldn't eat it. I'm giving two stars bc the rice is pretty good along with salsa. I won't waste my money here again.

I go to this location at least once a week and usually they are great. I went there today and got a bowl with white rice black beans and steak. The rice was hard like it wasn't cooked all the way. I called them just to let them know and the gentleman I was on the phone with said "I'm eating the rice right now and it's fine to me" and then said thank you and hung up. I didn't want free food from this but I would have appreciated to have been taken care of like a customer who did or at least not have made me feel dumb for letting him know about the rice..

My favorite place to go eat is chipotle at this location Enrique is always very helpful and always smiling I work near by and they make it easy and fast to help me out when I only have a 30 min lunch great customer service I have gone more than 10 times love it

I put one just for review purposes but its a complete "0"... this place is racist, this is not the first time ive been here and they did the same thing over again but this time im gonna put a review, they serve too small and im not usually a complainer but this time even my son would complain how much serving they gave me, the one serving is even asking me to pay extra to add some more meat but im like why do i have to pay when the previous serving was obviously more than mine and they dont need to pay extra. Just something to think about people, serve someone how you want to be served.

My first time here it used to be Baja Fresh , I order a steak burrito. It was beans and rice than steak then the streak wasn't cocked good, it was kinda raw. I told that to one of the employees and the answer was that depends who's the cock that day that's how the meat is going to be cock. Can u believe that ? So thumb down. Maybe with time they will learn how to cock.

As far as chipotles go, this is a good one.   The staff is friendly and the place is clean.  I think their burritos are tasty.   They always make them pretty fat and the food seems to be fresh to me.  There is always a respectable amount of meat in the burrito and you get a nice bang for your buck.   Does it feel like authentic Mexican food.... No, but it's very good and they load it up with whatever you want in it.   They charge you extra for guac, but I think most people know that comes with the territory.

Industrial chic meets American Mexican.  This is yet another solid location for lunch or a quick, cheap dinner that won't leave you in a food coma due to grease and sugar.  The place is clean and the servers seemed to be genuinely interested in doing a good job, which is nice to see nowadays!  For those who have never been to a Chipotle, it is basically a choose-your-own-adventure Mexican style.  Select your structure (bowl, salad, burrito, taco), protein, toppings, pay, and enjoy.  Good, clean food that will fuel you for whatever faces you after your meal!

Great! Chipotle is my favorite. This location is beautiful and close to home.

Service is always on point and the food is awesome!
Great service :) very attentive and made my hard taco shells fresh . Yummm. I will come back and bring my friends
New location with friendly staff :) their burritos and tacos are great and super fresh
Guys, it's chipotle. The burritos, the chips and guac. But I remember the good ol' days when guac was only 50 cents extra. Last time I went it was $1.50 LOL. Whaaaaaaat.

Not the busiest location but that did not stop them from good service. Gave me exactly what I ordered and in a very timely manner. While out in Vegas I have such short lunch breaks so it is good to know that they can prepare a quick lunch.
I LOVEEEEEEE CHIPOTLE! I can never say anything bad about them. My food is always fresh, and the service always on point.

Chipotle is my favorite restaurant because Chipotle IS LIFE! My rating is not based off the food because Chipotle food is always great and always deserves a 5 star. My rating is specifically based off of the service and speed. 
Let me say that the workers there were very nice. They were nice, but you could tell they were flustered and nervous. 
There was like 3 people in line and they seemed overwhelmed (this is compared to others who do fine with lines out the doors). 
The gentleman in front of me started his order and the lady behind the counter left his food sitting there. When she came back, she threw away what she started (since it was cold) and made him a new one. 
Total time took about 15 min to order and everything, so it was a lot slower than most chipotle. 
Food was great like always. 
Hopefully once they get used to working it will speed up!
This location is by my house, so it is the one that I often go to. However, it can either be hit or miss in terms of service.

I frequent this Chipotle often because it's right near my house and it is honestly hit or miss. Tonight my boyfriend and I went and began our usual order. Only after they gave us rice in our bowls, they told us "we are out of chicken, it'll be 5 minutes". We agreed to wait and ten minutes later we were able to get our order. Every once in awhile this location is always out of something. This occasion the chicken; one time they were out of corn salsa and another time they were out of chips. And when they do have chips they are normally stale or a soda fountain isn't working

After the chipotle scare in Oregon, we were not looking forward to coming but we did. It food is the same, hot, fresh, but it seems like the customer service takes a back seat to the food. I hope the employees don't think that because they can't make a mistake on the food 98% of he time that they can't be friendly and polite. 
They wrapped all our food to go, but if they were to ask us hey would of known it was for here. We got a burrito and a bowl, both were good but when they places my husbands burrito in the bag, all the juice and heavy parts few to the left side of his burrito, so now that they wrapped it evenly, it was now pointless because they put it sideways in a bag. I always love chips and guacamole, but why is that ever chipotle I go to, my chips are stale? Do they not make the chips there are bag them each day, not just whenever they run out of bags? Besides that, there was no smile from any of he employees, there was a thank you from the cashier but it was like a thank you and I don't care kind of thank you.

I eat here at least once a week. Yes, im one of THOSE people...the service here has always been really great and they never argue when I ask for extra of any ingredient (im a triple serving of sour cream kind of girl...). I never have had to wait in line for more than five minutes either. Super speedy, never crowded, and the staff all seems to work well as a team.

Service is always terrible. Employees act like they don't want to be there. I've come to this location twice this week and my rice was hard. They also told me that they couldn't separate only onions from the fajita mix even though they usually do. The lady had an attitude when I told her they usually do and she purposely overlooked my tortillas I ordered on the side. I didn't know how badly they were over cooked until I got home which is 15 mins away. I called to speak to the manager junior who was terrible. Not accommodating in any way telling me hold on so he can go check the rice because he hasn't gotten any other complaints. That has nothing to do with my bowl. If I didn't live 15 min away I taken the food back along with their terrible service. (This was a few weeks ago) UPDATE: I am hear now and someone forgot to peel the outer layer of the onion before making the fajita mix... I remember why I haven't been coming here..:

Well I wish I could not give a star to this place at all! I used to love Chipotle but this outlet totally ruined it for me. I ordered a chicken bowl to go. As soon as I ate, I got sick and was nauseated. Within minutes I was throwing up. When I complained to the Manager, he took my details and told me that the Corporate would contact me as they take these things very seriously. But NO luck!!!! They never emailed or responded back. Just refunded my money back. Honestly its not the $10 I want back, I was sick and weak after eating and they did nothing! No Chipotle for me and fam for life now.

My first time at this particular location and first time ordering online with out having to wait when I got there.......So I thought.  

I placed my pick time for 3:45pm. Upon my arrival , at 3:45pm, there was one person at the register.  I completely understand that the cashier had to take care of the person before me.  I was asked if I was here for pick.  Then was told my order would be ready in a few minutes. I expressed my disappointment and was given an excuse. 
A young crew working and some harmless flirting with other costumers while my order was being made. A young gentleman came out who I believe was the manager gave his apology and said would speak to his team. 

My order was ready, 10 minutes later.  Same amount of time if would have walked in rather than ordering online.
Horrible experience man literally terrible I got chips and guac and just got the guac
Great customer service. I was in and out in a matter of minutes at lunch time. Employees have great attitudes with how they interact with the customers. Keep up the great service!!

Nevermind on my last review. Everyone is always so short and kinda rude. The food is blah and I saw a live roach the last (and I do mean last) time I was there right by my table. The last place here (Baja Fresh) got shut down because of a bug infestation. Clearly not any better. Won't trust it.

We had to wait extra for steak to be done for our tacos and the guy at the register (didn't catch his name) gave us drinks for having to wait.
Great customer service, we didn't mind waiting that was just so nice.

Oh Chipotle I can't believe I'm here after all the shocking news about the food. Eh I feel like if I'm going to get sick it can happen anywhere but anyways they saved the day because I was starving like a you know what. I checked my mail and low and behold a coupon for a FREE burrito or tacos! YES PLEASE! I came on down and was excited to eat whatever literally. The staff were all pleasant to work with I was greeted immediately and helped very quickly! The problem I usually have with Chipotle is the small portions of meat they try to put on your food. Well without asking I was served with a decent amount of the barbacoa on my burrito and the rest of the items to follow weren't lacking! No complaints at all! If I was a serious chipotle person I wouldn't mind coming back to this exact location!

This location is not as great as the others I've visited. The staffed seemed frazzled, maybe understaffed. I was rushed through the line very fast, I asked for double meat and got half the regular portion. (1/2 scoop). I tell the next person that I'd like double meat and she immediately The dining area was a bit disheveled.
But the most important thing, the food tasted awesome.

The place looked nice but when I ordered my burrito I asked them to put it on the press because I like my cheese melted.  I've had this done at the 3 other Chipotle's. Two were here in Vegas and one in SF. It seems like a simple request.  It doesn't hurt anything to stick my burrito on the press for 5 seconds. But I was denied and maybe it was in the way I was denied that further fueled my outrage.  I wasn't given a reason why it couldn't be put on and they just dismissed the idea completely and moved on.  Ridiculous!  But that wasn't all. My burrito was wrapped into the shape of a bloated square basically. Not long and rectangular-like like any other burrito I've ever seen but like a bloated square that I couldn't even get my mouth around to eat.  So when I'm half way through this thing chicken and rice is falling out all over the place. Next, I go to fill up my cup with Sprite only to get a mouthful of carbonated soda water in my mouth.  I tell them they needed to change it and they just stick an out of order sign on it. Guess I'm not having Sprite today either.  All in all, disgusting staff etiquette and lazy workers.  I will never eat at this Chipotle again and advise you not to either.  

DO. . . . . . .  .    NOT. . . . . . . . EAT. . . . . . . . . AT. . . . .  THIS. . . CHIPOTLE!!!

I've been coming to this location for a couple of years. I've never been disappointed with the food or the staff. This location is another typical example of another great chipotle franchise. Clean fast great health food,  being a business traveler chipotle is always my first choice for a healthy meal on the road. I highly recommend this location.

I had a great experience here. Food was fresh and their service was quick and phenomenal! I am used to waiting at the rainbow location so I no longer go to that one. I would rather drive to this location for fresh amazing service!

Had me a steak burrito, extra chicken with white rice, black beans, pico de gringo (lol) and corn. 
The burrito was bomb as usual. 
Fast friendly service. 
Place was clean. 
Will eat here again.

I knew there was a reason I stopped coming here. Simple order. Chicken tacos. Who is out of protein at noon??? So my tortillas sat on the counter getting cold with cold beans as 4 people passed me in line while I waited. They didn't seem to be in a hurry to have actual food to serve either. Definitely will not return. Left without food.

Pretty bomb! Got a bowl, gave me free tortillas with my bowl, then homie sold me some queso... there was a hair in it but I told them; they gave me some salsa for free free. Also had some stale chips so they gave me some new ones.

We always order the chicken bowl with white rice, pinto beans, mild salsa and corn. It's very filling and have never been disappointed. We would get the bowl with guacamole more often, but that add on is a bit pricey. This location had friendly and efficient staff.

Chipotle is very good and always consistent.  I guess the only few problems I have with Chipotle is the food doesn't stay hot for very long.  By the time I sit down my burrito is barely warm.  I always get the steak burrito and it's very good.  I substitute fajita veggies into my burrito and I love it.  My kids.love the kids meal where you get to build your own taco.  One huge complaint I have is the new queso is terrible.  It's lumpy and not very flavorful.  It has almost like a grainy consistency to it.  I was so excited to see they offer queso but it's a huge fail in my opinion.  Ask for a sample, it's awful.  For a quick bite of Mexican, Chipotle is a great choice.

I was never too impressed by their other locations but this one is great! They are quick and friendly and the food is always delicious! Inside is also very clean and outside they have a seating area too.

Not sure why, but they threw away food, left and right. When the person in front me ordered her salad, they were out of black beans, so she agreed to wait 15 seconds, but the worker threw it out and started again when the beans came out. Then the person after me ordered, they were out of steak, he agreed to wait 30 seconds, the worker threw his food out and started again when the steak came out. I was left baffled. Why do you throw food away like that? It did not seem like any of the bins were stocked with food either. We came at rush hour and to see this type of service, it needs to be brought to management attention.

Two stars for the apps failure to process the food I ordered. It gave me a pickup time of 3:15pm but when I got to the store there was no food order that came thru. The line was of course long and I had to go in line to put my order in. This was so irritating and beats the purpose of using the app.

I'm not picky at all, with that being said first off. Your business is suppose to have at least decent customer service. Overall. You're establishment, that the employee is representing...is receiving my money. In exchange for something. 

This location has to have the WORST customer service in that entire shopping center...Wal-Mart is in this shopping center...

This is a really great Chipotle! The restaurant is always clean and fully stocked with chips, napkins, etc. All the staff here seem to be really nice and helpful, and there is always a line, but the line move very quickly. My chicken is always seasoned greatly, and I also enjoy my chipotle burrito bowl.I also like that none of the staff gets upset when I ask for extra everything.

This location has tables located on a nice patio area for outdoor seating.

A Chipotle even closer to me!  We ordered to go and I noticed that you can even order online. There was no one there probably because no one realizes that it's opened yet but it is!

We ordered the usual...a chicken burrito and a Barbacoa bowl. They put a bunch of meat in my bowl but not enough rice which is fine. My meat was a bit on the dry side but I'm sure they are still working out the kinks. Overall it's still one of my favorite semi fast food places.

Chipotle close to my home? Yay!!! I like Chipotle and the fresh ingredients they use. I like that you could build your own burrito or bowl. They have one of the best tortillas & guacamole. Try the sofrita if you want all vegetarian. Service is fast, price is reasonable, place is clean. We are now regulars at this location.  :)

Small parking lot, so there is an illusion of being busy, but this one seems to be one of the ones 'less traveled' (just a few customers, noticed more "to-go" orders). We've been here a couple of times, and both times were really good. The front counter area is well-organized and fully stocked with items (chips, boxes, catering supplies). Chipotle is pretty much a staple for our family, and we usually visit a couple weekends a month. If we miss it, my hubby gets withdrawals. Yes, really.

The food trays were filled halfway or more (a good sign, more fresh). More food prep and cooking was under way (sizzling, mmm). The staff is nice. This is a clean restaurant overall. Music is playing (twice, one type for the customers, one type for the employees making the food). We've chosen the same booth for both past visits, near the counter. This location is sort of bare-bones (but that's ok) with overall decor, not much is hanging on the walls. Most locations are industrial- feeling with exposed pipe type ceilings, a mix of metal and unfinished natural wood (the one @ Decatur/Sahara is a good representation of most restaurants in this chain). 

My favorite bowl is composed of: white rice, either Chorizo or Chicken, depending on my mood, black beans, fajita veggies, corn, some cheese, some sour cream, and lettuce. I used to get salsa but I split the bowl with my son, and he said it was "too hot." Sometimes, I get it on the side. I was just thinking that my son must be growing up because he hasn't been saying "Mum-mum" which is his code phrase for "More, please." But I heard it yesterday, so, it was a highlight, to hear it. He loves Chipotle. Once he hears we're going, he thinks we're going right then and there. It is a joy when our picky eater can eat something with such ferocity and enthusiasm.  

Also does online ordering and catering. I'm trying to figure which one will be our go-to in our new area, so this could be the one. It's a good thing, it's not super busy.

Updated review. Nothing has changed at all! Came here on Sunday at 8pm. Ordered two steak bowls only to be told that the steak wasn't ready and would take only " a few minutes more." Who is in charge of this place? Poor planning on his/her part. If steak is your most popular item you don't start cooking it when there's no more left. Every time I've been here so far the steak isn't ready. Tired of it. We just left the place and went to Panda down the street. Now I mean it when I say I won't be back!!

Been coming here for years but today I left happier than *usual, sometimes irritated because some servers are so stingy! I always get a Veggie Bowl with brown rice without beans and with everything else. The server girl today Sunday 04/23 5:20pm ish (not the cashier)  hooked it up with other ingredients instead since I didn't want beans. Happy mouth and tummy YAY! - we were the extra lettuce Asian couple in Rayban shades lol. Thanks!

I've eaten at a lot of Chipotles, so I know when a location is off. Being the fatty that I am, I like chipotle because they give you a large burrito......that being said, this place was seriously skimping on everything. I had to ask for extra everything just for for burrito to come close to normal size. I saw other patrons burritos come out super small. I've seen this at another location before where I had some friends as employees, and they confirmed that the manager was knowingly forcing his employees to make everything smaller that company standards.........I wonder if this is the case at this location as well.

Known fact Chipotle Mexican Grill is suffering in many ways.  Recently we have noticed an obvious management order for line servers to reduce the quantity of every item sold.  Less rice, less meat/chicken etc.  Even the weight of a bag of chips has declined. You must ask for a knife, salt, bottled hot sauce.  Clear signs of desperation. 

The only thing that has not declined is prices. 

Today, the fewer than usual chips were soggy with oil.  The second bag was just as tasteless. 

Our return visits are becoming less frequent.  You're doing it to yourselves Chipotle.

This is probably my 10th time coming here. I was greeted at the door from all the staff.... Literally "welcome to chipotle!!!!!!" Well this is different, they are taking the subway greeting approach which I don't mind. The staff was nice and urgent since I had 8 people following behind me. The tables were clean and the food was amazing! I got the salad yum.

Hadn't had Chipotle in a long time so I thought I would stop at this location. I wasn't impressed with the food. It was just mediocre.  Plus, the tacos I ordered they didn't put lettuce on them because they didn't have any.

I spoke to the cashier about my bill.  She didn't do what I would have done if I was in her position working in the food industry.  It was a technicality for over charging me.  It doesn't even come out of the store, it's Chipotle company deals for members.   I came in today, because I wanted to use my BOGO before it expires.  I also have been waiting to try out the online order.  I normally order in person two entrees with guacamole on the side with the meals.  When I did the order online, it asks me if I wanted my guacamole on the side, I clicked on it.  When I came into the store, I noticed I was charged a little more with my BOGO.  It wasn't half the bill.  She charged me for 2 entrees with two side orders of guacamole instead of guacamole within my entree.  When I look online on my order receipt, it's shown the guacamole is within the entree not a side order.  I told her that, she said I can't order like that.  Next time order with the guacamole and side note to type there I want it on the side.  I told here there isn't a section to do that.  She kept telling me there is one.  I can't be crazy....I just checked before writing this review... there isn't a section for that.  All of this for $1.95 guacamole.  I told her ok whatever.  It's a simple fix, it's a technicality charge.  What pissed me off even more, when I got home, one of my entree was missing cheese.... I would say the communication with the online order is not good experience.  I was overcharged more  for technicality and my order isn't correct.  Good thing, she checked the order again before handing it to me, because there was a missing guacamole.  

That's one.... now a week ago I was here again.  I came in with no one in front of me ordering.  But right after I ordered one burrito and a bowl, the line started to build up.  I can tell the server started to get irritated while she was doing me order.  It was the fajita veggies on both entrees that got me.  It was old looking and empty, the girl literally grabbed one bell pepper and 3 onion stings for the burrito and the same for the bowl.  I even asked her can I have a little more and she just added 2 onion stings... can't she just grab a fresh one?  Then she turned around and yelled at her coworkers, "I need help!"  Every ingredients they had were low, they made my two entrees really light than usual, I didn't bother to keep asking for more for every ingredient.  

I'm going to go to the other location on Rainbow to try it out.  It's too bad that this location is convenience because it's by our mailbox.  But you go where it makes you happy.

I have been a loyal fan of Chipotle for many years. I am a vegetarian and their food suits my needs for what I like to eat and the fact that I am able to choose what I can put in my order.When they started having difficulties with their food safety numerous times I even continued to be a loyal customer. However the last few times I have been there have not been a good experience or value. I generally have rice, no beans, vegetables and lettuce. When I asked for extra white rice I was told that they were only allowed three scoops and that was it, when I asked for extra lettuce (one of the cheapest items of the selections), they gave me a very small handful. I had to come home and cut up my own lettuce! I was treated rudely when I asked for extra vegetables, because that's all I eat. I was not allowed to have a tortilla on the side as I usually am. My vegetable Bowl costs within a few cents the same as a bowl full of meat and high-cost items. My daughter-in-law ordered a baracoba bowl and and the meat was all fat. I'm having a very hard time to continuing to be a loyal customer to Chipotle when there's no value in my food choices  anymore. I hope they fix this the right way , instead of hitting the customer in the food quantities and in the pocketbook. it's not a good way to keep your customers coming back.

Came here tonight 3/15 just after 8pm. We got take-out, drove 5 mins home, and it's like we just took our food out of the refrigerator it's STONE COLD.  How does that happen? We ordered different meat, beans, and rice. It's like the entire hot well was off and no one noticed.  I'll be sure to update this when I get whatever food poisoning is headed my way.

Turn the annoying, obnoxious music way down or off would be ideal !!! Are u fricken kidding me ?? Its bad enough your prices are ridiculous but I have to sit here and get a headache ???!!! Thanks for nothing aholes !

A few weeks ago I had dinner at this location with a friend we ordered and came to the cashier I asked for lemons and she looked behind and said oh there's none anymore I love lemon on my food so I class very disappointed she didn't even offer to go to the back and get some so I sat down and about 2 mins later comes David with a great smile and amazing customer service asked if everything was okay and is there anything we needed so I asked him for lemons but a smile he said oh that's easy no problem a minute later comes David with cut lemons he went back there and cut himself . That's what I call great customer service ! You turn my frown upside down thank you!

Hi again... The chorizo was fantastic today. I hope it stays like this. It was amazing. I actually got a double portion of meat today and it was delicious... Also kudos to the girl with the tattoos on her left arm, looks to be Latina... She's always nice and even when it's busy I see her working diligently. Great job! Also Stephanie, I know her name because she was my cashier today but she is nice too. I'm sure there are more nice people but I run into these two most frequently so... Stay Awesome! 

Oh yeah, and whoever cooked the chorizo today... You da man. Or woman.

On their cup it says something about how they won't nickel and dime you for sides (ie: guacamole, sour cream, beans, Pico de gallo, ect). On the day I was there that seems to be all they were doing. I asked for a few sides and the man behind the counter said 'that will be 90Â¢ per item.' Uh isn't that exactly what you said you weren't going to do. The other chipotle locations throughout the valley don't charge you like this.

OK, perhaps I just caught the stomach flu or something and it was not the food at Chipotle.  Talked to my neighbor and she had the same symptoms, but did not eat at Chipotle.  I've eaten here so many times with no problems.

I decided to walk out in the middle of my order because the spicy-attitude of the Latina cheated the amount of chicken for my bowl and she tried to charge me extra meat for an even smaller spoon than the fist one. I like chipotle but I guess I'll just have to find another location with not such small minded taker attitudes. Over a couple pieces of chicken they rather loose me immediate and long term business and the lady threw away the bowl wasting all the food anyways. So dumb
My once per week lunch spot. Clean, fast, & new. Good service & food portions. Great idea to open this location!

I wish I remembered this gentleman's name. I went back to this Chipotle in the day time as both my evening experiences were horrid. 

My daughter and I made our order. I ordered guac and chips and I said to the gentleman "please please make sure I get my guac, the last time they forgot it and I raged and Ericka was no help" 

He said "Ma'am I'm going to take care of that right now for you " and he didn't charge me for the guac and Chips. 

I told him I did not need it for free I just wanted to make sure I got it.  He said here is one for this order and here is another for the one you missed last time. 

And you know what he didn't get the 5 star review because he gave me free guac n chips. 

He got the 5 star review for Chipotle because he understood why I was upset he acknowledged it with the "oooh she is still mad about that guac missing " 

And I was. And he saw right through it and handled it by making us laugh, feel comfortable and then accommodating me. 

It was excellent management skills. I'm going go to Chipotle tomorrow just to get his name. 

And he never once made me feel like I did something wrong. Or that I should have to do something extra to get what I was ousted on. Thanks kind sir

My first time eating here! And I am very impressed! What a delicious burrito. Love how they make it right in front of you, and its so big and juicy! Very cool spot for sure! Nice employees and super clean.

Now, I have to write this only because it was a bit disturbing...Me and my sister probably were there for about an hour eating, talking and having a good time...in the time we were there we witnessed at least three homeless people come in and fill up their mugs or whatever container they had with the soda machine, use the restroom facilities and casually walk out without paying. Ok, I understand its hot outside and they are thirsty, but when you are a paying customer its a little disturbing to see this happening as you're eating. We even told an employee, and they said, its ok, we know they are doing it and they dont mind. Im sure the owner would mind! 

Anyway, still an awesome burrito and yes I am a FAN!

This Chipotle has amazing customer service. The staff was friendly and greeted us with enthusiasm. The cashier Amia (I assume that was her name based on my receipt) was especially kind and helpful. If I wasn't moving out of state this would be my new go to location.

Do not go to this chipotle!!! It's so bad! First off, they forget about my kid's quesadilla. Don't have the kids cardboard to separate the rice and beans. Chorizo is BURNT TO THE CRISP. They burnt my quesadilla! hardly ANY cheese in my quesadilla!! I mean how can you forget to put cheese in there! The portions suck! Don't know how to wrap a burrito. I am so disappointed. I want to contact corporate because they need some serious training. I love chipotle but just not this location.
